posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.33 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you’d like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium!

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Complete list of new commits since 7.32.2
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.32.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

Hello! The link+sync stuff needs another beta cycle to cook. Thankfully, the release of the feature is completely controlled by desktop and iPad (it tells us if it supports the feature when we attempt to link), so no real changes on Android, but please continue to test the feature if you can!

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Obtainium
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.32 release
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.33.0 (151000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

33 new commits since 7.32.2:

Show commits

  • Update linked device education logic. [1]

  • Fix cut off linking text. [2]

  • Fix save toast formatting. [3]

  • Respect flash setting while recording video. [4]

    Resolves #13946

  • Convert WebRtcCallingActivity to Kotlin. [5]

  • Save outgoing message bodies as trimmed. [6]

  • Convert WebRtcCallViewModel into Kotlin. [7]

  • Support searching for emoji by emoji itself. [8]

    Resolves #13964

  • Enforce no grouping in currency formatter, to be consistent with MoneyFilter. [9]

    Fixes #13922
    Resolves #13923

  • Fix Scheduled MmsMessage DateTime visibility. [10]

    Resolves #13967

  • Ensure notification profile visibility updates on all tabs. [11]

    Resolve #13945

  • Clamp videos to max duration after media quality change. [12]

    Fixes #13930
    Resolves #13932

  • Update linked device string. [13]

  • Fix call screen pip aspect ratio in large landscape group calls. [14]

  • Add migration to repair missing FTS triggers. [15]

  • Bump libsignal version to v0.65.5 [16]

  • Revamp restore decisions state and flesh out post registration restore options. [17]

  • Update LibSignalChatConnection to use new ChatConnection API rather than ChatService [18]

  • Fix foldable camera issues. [19]

  • Add 'you' case for rejecting a group request. [20]

  • Ignore status code errors for group updates if Signal timestamp header missing. [21]

  • Do not connect to web socket until restore decision made. [22]

  • Prevent accidental copy of date received in message details screen. [23]

  • Bump libsignal to v0.65.6 [24]

  • Fix full screen incoming call view. [25]

  • Fix flickering text caused by calling onSizeChanged en-masse. [26]

  • Fix reading free tier days from backup configuration. [27]

  • Ensure backup failures halt ArchiveUploadProgress. [28]

  • Implement 1:1 call mutes state. [29]

  • Add fixes to country picker. [30]

  • Update translations and other static files. [31]

  • Update baseline profile. [32]

  • Bump version to 7.33.0 [33]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.32.2…v7.33.0

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Wooo, so fast to fix the call screen issue!!

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
updates-bot:

Respect flash setting while recording video. [4]

Sounds crazy but this commit just made my week lol. I’m so glad flash works in videos now!

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Sounds crazy but this commit just made my week lol. I’m so glad flash works in videos now!

You can thank Sagar, an external contributor who made that PR, as well as many others recently :)

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Is there any chance there can be a grace reply period, where you can ask a message request who they are without sharing your profile? I kind of don’t want to change it just so they don’t see my profile info, and then manually have to change it back after confirming the contact is spam.

https://community.signalusers.org/t/signal-7-32-2-lockscreen-call-notifications-not-showing-up-any-more-android-11-12-14/66634

Is this going to be fixed in Android 7.33 release?

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
The proximity sensor broke again in calls. It is not turning off the screen when near the ear.
I am not sure what’s happening but it’s at least the 3rd or 4th time that this breaks

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.32.3/81c50ce2321e222830f67c626345aaf9fa6ea163cabc4c9c04f1e57ad9b1b8d3

posts.name: Turgidson
posts.cooked: Proximity sensor won't turn off the screen during calls · Issue #12553 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub has been open since 2022

link_counts.title: Proximity sensor won't turn off the screen during calls · Issue #12553 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked: What’s the reason for this bug to be open since so long? Does it change per device or OS version? This is not a small bug annoyance, it is disruptive for main features (calls and listening to audio messages).

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
sigfun:

What’s the reason for this bug to be open since so long?

It’s not consistent across devices. Oftentimes we can’t reproduce it.

Fix proximity sensor issue especially during audio call.

posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

It’s not consistent across devices. Oftentimes we can’t reproduce it.

FWIW I can reproduce pretty much on demand on two Pixels, both running up to date OEM OS.

link_counts.title: Proximity sensor won't turn off the screen during calls · Issue #12553 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
an interesting message duplication bug: i sent a message with a typo, quickly went to edit it to remove the typo but accidentally sent an empty edit. i immediately noticed that and went to edit again, and it seems i managed to send the second edit before the first one fully sent, which resulted in a duplicated message.

Screenshot_20250211-105705_Signal718×149 85.1 KB

both appear on the receiver end as well, and have different timestamps (1739267790699, 1739267793884), but have an identical edit history showing all three stages:

Screenshot_20250211-105842_Signal719×646 70.5 KB

which is doubly weird, since for the first message the edit history claims the present form is that without the typo, despite that not being the case as you could see.

I found that if you answer a call directly from the lockscreen the proximity sensor is not activated so it won’t shut the screen off. If you unlock your device and go back to the call, the sensor works as it should (at least for me).

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Image messages sent by me are previewed as black images until I close and open the chat: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.33.2/cbb98144c9f4656120af55424fca76829c2696d5400c27f322923e13e7ac7a60

Message ID: 1739319679912

As soon as I send an image, it shows up in the chat as a black square. It doesn’t happen always, can’t consistently reproduce it
